Reviews.Title: “Tired, worn out, dirty property fits well with disrespectful, lazy staff.”
Reviews.Author: TDAtraveler
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in at the front desk, when asked if I was enrolled in their rewards program, I was directed to their brochure holder and told "it is really better if you do this yourself when in your room". When I found out I was already enrolled but couldn't access the site I was again told that I had to deal with it myself even though when you turn on the TV it clearly states to "enroll at the front desk". The room was way past due for renovation, broken tiles in the bathroom, dirty floor next to the toilet, scratched, worn finish on sink, tub, faucets, toilet seat, etc., parts missing from the microwave turn table, huge white stain plus another dark stain on ottoman, lint, threads on carpeting indicating that the room was not vacuumed, toilet bubbled and water rose when the toilet next door was flushed, toilet seat was up upon arrival and it appeared as if it had been used (needed to be flushed). Regarding the common areas, dirty elevator, worn finishes, horrible looking substance laying on the base of the bellman's cart (appeared to be fresh vomit or some other sort of bodily waste), limited breakfast items (we were looking for bananas and were told by the breakfast attendant who was sitting eating breakfast himself in the dining room that they had not shopped for him and therefore he was out but that we should try banana yogurt instead), Snow so deep you really needed boots even though it had not snowed for 36 to 48 hours and they clearly had not plowed or had only plowed minimally, very few parking spaces since most were evidently dedicated to "park and fly" customers since most of the cars had not moved since before the snowfall, old car parked under the canopy, never moved, etc. etc. etc. I would expect this out of an economy hotel or independent but clearly need to be wary of Wyndham/Wingate in the future as well!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel really needs some maintenance.”
Reviews.Author: familylady67
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 2 nights and were very disappointed. The first indications of neglected maintenance were huge weeds in the sidewalk as we approached the hotel lobby. The room we were assigned had such a warped bathroom door that we had to slam it to keep it closed. The worst problem was that the handle on the shower would not stay put and kept getting hotter. In addition to the cobweb on the wall, this was the last straw. The next morning a very helpful woman at the front desk gave us a new room which was satisfactory. In addition to the maintenance problems, she was the only employee that was pleasant. I think some employee would help this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Your basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex1154555
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a baseball tournament. I had never heard of the hotel before so I wasn't sure what it expect. It had an odd style to it. I wasn't a big fan of it but I'm sure others are. The room was what you expect. Had everything you needed. There wasn't a screen on my window so I was wary of opening my window. The AC unit would go on and off sometimes. It was kind of odd. The breakfast area was large and inviting and the staff at the front desk were nice and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Parking Service”
Reviews.Author: JustMeNU4
Reviews.Content: I am highly disappointed in the service received Saturday evening upon returning from a family trip. I followed the instructions provided to let the service know we were ready for pick up. From the time I originally called to notify the driver that we had landed, it took the driver over an hour and a half to pick us up. The hotel is about 10-15 mins away. The driver proceeded to tell us that the reason for her delay was that she took a nap. That she had been up since 3am and needed a nap. While I understand being tired during a shift, I do NOT understand actually taking time to nap on the job when you've been contacted to pick someone up within the next 30 mins. She never apologized for her actions and addressed it in a manor as if to say we should know better than to take offence to her actions. I was never at any point rude but very upset that she proceeded to make small talk again with no apology. I would think twice before using this service for a Park & Fly

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: lasfloras
Reviews.Content: Wow, this hotel was really nice!! We were a loud and noisy bunch all over the place at many different hours and we weren't the only large group, so the staff were busy! And, they were great! Pros: easy checkin, nice lobby/breakfast area = easy hangout space for afterhours, near a Sam's Club (front desk staff let me borrow a card to shop for a birthday cake), nice rooms = clean, spacious, decent a/c unit, Neutrogena toiletries, comfy bed and quiet rooms, cordless phone, flat screen tv, nice furniture, fridge and microwave + coffee pot, standard inroom safe, etc.; indoor pool, not large, but nice appearance, decent meeting room space, nice carpeting in halls and rooms, good lighting and plenty of mirrors in the rooms. Cons: no alarm clock in my room, no extra shower light/heat lamp, bathroom door sticks on the bath rug, .....obviously these are minor!!! The staff were very nice and accommodating and just lovely!!! The breakfast was hearty and well-stocked, lots of teas, hot oatmeal, waffles, eggs, sausage, cereal, pastries juices, coffees, etc. Shuttle to/from the airport was prompt (just remember to reserve it for the hourly departure when you want to return to the airport). 24 hour free business center to check email and print boarding passes and all that stuff was very helpful, too. Really, Liz, Lisa and her staff were just wonderful for our family wedding party! And, before, I forget, there are other hotels and a restaurant/bar within walking distance as well as the Sam's Club. A slightly more difficult walk, due to a cross street, includes a liquor store, Mexican food shop (bought the birthday candle there), a gas station and a few other little shops.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: dc_girly_girl
Reviews.Content: We were traveling to Des Moines for the holidays and this was the place we decide to hang our hat for the night. Upon walking in, we were offered a king suite at $80. It was sizeable and clean room with a whirlpool tub. Cookies were out at night in the lobby for snacking and a large breakfast was included in the morning. Breakfast was self-serve with basic scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, muffins & toast and a make your own waffle. No complains at all.

Reviews.Title: “a great deal with the 30% discount”
Reviews.Author: chris_grass
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay here because they were offering 30% off with a 3 night stay. We were in town for a Colts game and the hotel was a short drive from downtown (15 minutes). The general manager checked me in and she was most polite and helpful. She even gave me a map of the shopping areas which were about 3 miles west of the hotel. We found a movie theatre, several large stores and lots of restaurants in that area. Our room was large and included a king bed, a desk and a chair with an ottoman. There was plenty of room for a couch, which would have been more useful. The free internet was great. Our bathroom was clean, but the fixtures looked a bit dated. On the plus side, the shower had a variable speed head which I was actually able to adjust -- most of the time when you try to adjust them you end up just about unscrewing the enitre shower head. Our bed was adequate-- too hard for my liking. The HVAC unit wasn't terribly efficient either -- it was either on or off. When it was on, it was entirely too hot. If we turned it down, it did not keep the room at a consistent temperature. The breakfast was OK. They offered more hot items than most motels, which was nice. They had eggs every day and alternated between ham and sausage. There were biscuits and gravy, but one morning they ran out of gravy, another morning they ran out of biscuits. When I asked the breakfast attendant about them he answered that "someone had gone to get them". The breakfast attendant was about the only unfriendly person in the place-- he did not speak well, wore baggy jeans and even a knit cap one morning. He did not present well. A guest with a dog walked into the breakfast area one morning and no one asked her to leave. Fortunately, she did not stay long.I am glad that we didn't pay full price for this motel. But for the price we paid, it was adequate.

Reviews.Title: “SOOOO comfortable!!”
Reviews.Author: SoCalC8
Reviews.Content: This place might not be the highest class of hotel but I had a great experience staying here. Check in was fast and the staff was very friendly. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds that I have ever slept in. The TV was a flat screen but I had some bad reception on a lot of the channels. Room was quiet and laundry was good. This place is right next door to a Sam's Club so it's very convenient. The fridge, microwave and coffee maker was great. I liked it here!

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping Staff inept, and yes, it attracts the local drunks/partiers”
Reviews.Author: TripleJackInGA
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to attend a show at the convention center, as it was only a few miles away, plus it seemed a lot cheaper. By the time you add in the $14 per day parking at the convention center, plus the hassle of driving back and forth, and the fact that Wingate is a completely inconsistent brand, I should have booked at the Hampton downtown. The property looks great from the outside, and the lobby is fine. Hallways all seem OK, but the rooms do seem just a bit dated. The only real problem I had with the room was that the housekeeping staff DOES NOT know how to clean a toilet! I don't know about you, but from time to time you actually have to clean the *outside* of the toilet too!! I brought this to the attention of the fro0nt desk the first morning after I had arrived. I told them I wanted to speak to the Manager, but was told she would be in later. I told them what the problem was, in a very firm way, although not rude. Of course the guy at the front desk did absolutely nothing, except look like a scalded dog. He never even passed along my complaint to the manager, who of course was not there when I got back that evening, or any other time I asked for her, which was at least twice a day while I was there. Old and outdated is one thing, but you can clean a room, no matter how old it is. Other than that, the only problem with the room was that, as others have mentioned, the walls/floors must be made of paper-mache(?). Oh, and what others said about this hotel having a lot of drunks/partiers there on the weekend is absolutely true from my experience. On the night of 2/9, it was obvious that the party in room 317, right next to mine, were histing a party. There was lots of loud talking, running up and down the hallways, and general BS. I finally called the front desk at about 1AM, as I had to get up early. To his credit, the older gentleman (don't remember his name), came up and confronted the party, telling them that according to fire code, they could only have a maximum of 5 people in the room, so he broke it up. All in all, if it wasn't for the cleaning issue, the party-people issue, and the inability to talk with management, I might have given this place a better review. From now on, I've learned my lesson on business travel. Hampton Inn is the absolutely most consistent brand I know, and I know what I am getting before I get there.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable One Night Experience”
Reviews.Author: tpthaler
Reviews.Content: My father and I were attending a convention at the Indianapolis convention center, and we needed a place to crash for only one night (one of the longest nights of my life). We stayed in room 128, which was a nice and large room that was relatively clean but dated. It had a king sized bed and we requested a roll-a-way bed for the additional $10.00. After arriving at the hotel after an exhausting day travel and work I was hoping to take a nap. Both the bed and the roll-away-bed were the worst mattresses I have ever experienced in my life. I ended up putting the roll-a-way mattress on the floor and tried to take a nap while springs were digging into my body from various parts of the bed. After about only 10 minutes in the room I heard what sounded like a stampede of wild animals running through hotel (and this is not the Animal Kingdom lodge in Disney)... I was like, that was strange and went back to trying to get my nap in. And it happened again and again and again... Turns out we were by the stairs and they are hollow along with the walls and the mattresses. The hotel was also full of drunks that night, and they were making a lot of noise in the hallways (not the fault of the hotel, but it tells you the clients they attract). To top it all off, little kids (8-10 years old) were running through the halls knocking on all the doors as they passed. When bringing up the noise problems with the staff the following morning, all they said is "that's strange/unusual" and she did say she was working all night trying to keep the drunks in their rooms, but that she would look into it. The staff offered no concessions, and I ended up only getting 5 hours of sleep (even though I had been up for 20+ hours straight and I even took a prescription sleeping pill and wore earplugs). The only thing that turned out well is the fact that I was up at 4AM and was able to move my flight up from noon to 7am to get the heck out of there. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. If you are looking for an affordable yet nice experience go to the Microhotel a few hundred feet away, you can get two rooms there for about the price of one here and it was built in 2007 so it still has that "new hotel/motel" feel. Also, if you are looking for something to eat in the area there is a bar in the parking lot (along with a SamsClub) but we walked through there and the food looked terrible, so we tried the authentic Mexican restaurant across the street, and although we were the only two while, English speaking people in the restaurant we were treated well, and I have to admit it was some of the best Mexican (authentic) food I have ever experienced (and at a very reasonable price). Good luck, and even if you don't take my advice and you book a room at this hotel, ask for a room on the top floor and as far away from the steps as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelabit
Reviews.Content: The rooms were good, and the staff was excellent. The breakfast could be better, but they do have a large area available to eat in. The breakfast food selection is limited, and the waffle iron was really sticky, to the point that you could not get the waffle out with out it being split into a top and bottom piece. Most of the selection of cold items like cereal, yogurt, bread, apples and oranges. The dinning options in the area are limited, the next door hotel has a restaurant/bar, the beer is OK, but the food was bad. You can do much better for dinning in downtown Indianapolis. It is some distance to downtown, you will need to drive or take a cab to get there. The wired Internet worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near Indy!”
Reviews.Author: chrissyberry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Wingate for two nights on a business trip. It is very conveniently located close to the airport and just a 10 minute drive to local shopping and dining areas. My room was clean and spacious, and included a desk with a lamp and internet access, a comfy plus chair with an ottoman, a microwave and a mini-fridge. I only have two minor complaints: the cable channels were somewhat limited, and two pieces of equipment in the exercise room weren't functioning properly: the stationary bike and the step machine. The treadmill and the weight machine were fine. (The fitness center, overall, was more than I would have expected, so I was quite happy about that!) I didn't get the chance to try the pool or hot tub, but they looked inviting. The breakfast area was large and well organized. I have to compliment the staff on their efficiency. When I stayed, the hotel was at capacity --- there was a convention going on that brought a TON of teenagers into the city, and many of them were staying at the Wingate. They were all well behaved, and the single staff member working the breakfast area really kept up with the high demand in the morning. I would definitely stay here again, and in fact will request that my travel agent book a room for me here when I next come to Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Bad Fire Alarm”
Reviews.Author: mariek89
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for $80 per night. The room was clean and all of the appliances worked. Breakfast in the AM was terrific and there was a lot to choose from. The fresh waffles in the waffle iron were my husband's favorite. I especially liked the real coffee mugs that were set up with the coffee maker in the room! The only drawback to this hotel was the fire alarm. It went off at 9:30 pm(in every room and common area) and continued going off for about a half hour. The alarm was a piercing screech that literally hurt the ears. The fire trucks and personnel came, but as one firefighter told us, this false alarm problem was something that they responded to on a daily basis. That's a pretty serious problem if you ask me. Also, the pool and jacuzzi were closed for renovations. No one told us about this on the phone- it should have been mentioned. Basically, if you are traveling on business, this would be a great place to stay. I would recommend calling the hotel first to see if their fire alarm problem was fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jetsettinallie
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Indianapolis for work, and had to stay near the airport at a hotel under Govt. Per Diem. I came here to read the reviews of those available, and the Wingate Inn seemed to be the only non-disgusting choice. Not only was it not disgusting, it was wonderful. The lobby is spacious and modern with a huge area for breakfast. The people tending the front desk (woman when I signed in, man when I checked out) were friendly, caring and warm. I had a single non-smoking King. The room was huge, and reasonably clean (did have leftover soap in the shower on one of the soap dishes, both otherwise quite clean). Neutrogena toiletries, kitchenette, desk, wireless and TV internet. Int he morning, breakfast was plentiful with various pastries, muffins with sausage gravy, bacon, fruit, cereal and more. You pay the price of a lower end hotel but get a higher end hotel experience. I plan on staying there for future visits to this city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good except for the pool”
Reviews.Author: rizzop
Reviews.Content: My wife and kids (age 4 and 6) stayed with me at this hotel on our way back from Minnesota. This hotel has to be the best of the trip. It was spacious throughout and had all of the amenities that you would want. There was free wireless and a business center with a FAX machine and printer. The fitness center has a weight machine, bike and treadmill and maybe one or two other pieces of equipment. Our room had a couch with an ottoman and it had a refrigerator and microwave, all for $80. it was nicely laid out too. The hotel doesn't have a courtyard or anything but is located next to a Sam's Club and a Mediterreanean (sp?) restaurant. If you take Rockville Road towards the city, you'll find a grocery store. We arrived late for breakfast so some of the food was gone. There was a make-your-own waffle iron, bagels, breads, sausage gravy, pieces of fruit, cereal, milk, three kinds of juices and that's about all I can remember. The limited TV channels and the toxic pool was the bummer of this place. My wife missed her favorite show on Bravo because they only carry 18 or so channels. All of our eyes were stinging after a few minutes in the pool. The hot tub was not overly hot but it was not the chlorine soup that the pool was so the kids swam there too. It would be a five except for the pool, which could have just been a mistake made on that day. Despite that, we do plan to come here again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Location”
Reviews.Author: JaneB2
Reviews.Content: Wingate Inn offers everything you need in an airport hotel - nice rooms, pleasant lobby/check in, good breakfast, airport shuttle and nearby restaurants. I especially liked the easy chair and foot rest, you seldom see hotel chairs that allow you to put your feet up. The lobby has complimentary Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations for the price”
Reviews.Author: lschmidt
Reviews.Content: Very nice accomodations - everything was clean. Staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The free use of the business was helpful as we needed to use mapquest. Good breakfast buffet with eggs, sausage and waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for Park and Fly”
Reviews.Author: Champscme
Reviews.Content: Used their Park and Fly Rate paid $120 and you could park the car for unlimited days. I liked the fact that you could leave your car in the front of the building, near the front entrance, instead of in the back. There is a complimentary breakfast but did not get to try it, because of early morning flight. Staff was helpful and friendly. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The employees at the Wingate Hotel were very courteous and helpful. We had never been to Indianapolis, but they made us feel very at home with great restaurant referrals & directions, as well as went out of their way to make sure the complinentary breakfast met everyone's needs. The hotel was very clean & comfortable.

HotelInfo.Name: Wingate Inn - Indianapolis Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 5797 Rockville Road, Indianapolis, IN 46224
